abstract: China bars Anastasia Lin, Miss Canada, from attending 65th annual Miss World contest in southern island of Hainan, due to her outspoken advocacy for human rights and religious freedom in China; Lin says she is disappointed and angry, but not surprised; Chinese emigre is practitioner of Falun Gong, Buddhism-inspired movement denounced by China.
lead_paragraph: Miss Canada, Anastasia Lin, was denied a visa to attend the international pageant, apparently because she is outspoken about human-rights abuses in the country of her birth.

headline.main: China Bars Anastasia Lin, Miss World Canada (and Rights Advocate)
headline.print_headline: China Bars a Rights Activist Who Wields a Tiara and Sash

snippet: Miss Canada, Anastasia Lin, was denied a visa to attend the international pageant, apparently because she is outspoken about human-rights abuses in the country of her birth.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
